title: Kabbalah, Jewish Mysticism & Mandaean Gnosticism
description: The Jewish mystical tradition from the Zohar through Gershom Scholem's scholarship, plus the Mandaean Gnostic scriptures (Ginza Rabba) as a parallel esoteric tradition.

books.title: Canonical Prayer Book of the Mandaeans
books.author: E.S. Drower

keyTexts: Sefer HaBahir: Early Kabbalistic text, foundational for Zoharic Kabbalah
Zohar: The central text of Jewish mysticism, attributed to Moses de León
Ginza Rabba: 'Great Treasure' - central scripture of Mandaean Gnosticism
Mandaean Prayer Book: Liturgical texts of the last surviving Gnostic religion
researchValue: Essential for understanding Jewish mysticism and its influence on Christian Kabbalah (Pico, Reuchlin, Agrippa). The Mandaean texts document a parallel Gnostic tradition that survived into modernity.
